steps.name: Welcome to the Columbia River Estuary
steps.body:
You will need to do the following in order to set up the General NOAA Operational Modeling Environment for the Columbia River Estuary :

  1. Set the model run parameters.
  2. Input the wind conditions.

steps.title: Model Settings
steps.buttons: <button type='button' class='cancel' data-dismiss='modal'>Cancel</button><button type='button' class='back'>Back</button><button type='button' class='next'>Next</button>
<button type='button' class='cancel' data-dismiss='modal'>Cancel</button><button type='button' class='back'>Back</button><button type='button' class='next'>Next</button>

steps.title: Almost Done
steps.body:
You are ready to move to the Map Window to start your spill and run the model. Here are the tools you'll use :

To set the location of your spill(s), you will use the Spill Tool.

To run the model, you will use GNOME's run controls: Run, Pause, and Step.
steps.buttons: <button type='button' class='cancel' data-dismiss='modal'>Cancel</button><button type='button' class='back'>Back</button><button type='button' class='finish'>To the Map Window</button>
